content:
The President has 10 days to do 1 of 2 things:

	1.   they can sign it and it is a big deal on signing day

	2.   they can veto it which sends the bill back to congress
		they usually send it with a reason for why
		congress can then override the veto with 2/3rds vote in all of congress both chambers

after 10 days, if the president does not sign it, if congress is still in session the bill goes into action without president signature

after 10 days, if the president does not sign the veto and congress adjourns i.e. they are not in session. the bill dies here
